snippet: Samsung Electronics probably benefited from memory chip sales, analysts said, while HTC said it would lose about $101 million after its flagship smartphone failed to catch on.
abstract: Samsung, which is benefiting from its status as leading maker of semiconductors as well as smartphones, says it expects to post operating profit of 9.9 trillion won to 10.3 trillion won, or about $9.2 billion to $9.6 billion, in third quarter, up from 8.06 trillion won a year earlier; outlook contrasts strikingly with report from HTC, which posts net loss of 2.97 billion Taiwan dollars, or about $101 million, in third quarter, after net income of 3.9 billion Taiwan dollars year earlier.
lead_paragraph: Samsung Electronics probably benefited from memory chip sales, analysts said, while HTC said it would lose about $101 million after its flagship smartphone failed to catch on.

headline.main: HTC Reports Its First Loss, but Samsung Shows Vigor
headline.print_headline: HTC Reports Its First Loss, But Samsung Shows Vigor
